author: Marc Konchar
comment: On the Asus ZenWatch 2 the bottom card covers most of the barcode due to the last number dropping down to a 2nd row. Emailed developer months ago about it. Used to be one of my favorite apps but still can't use.
title: Barcode Covered on ZenWatch 2

author: Ray-Allen Taylor
comment: It would be great if the warchapp would turn if I flick my weist (so its upside down)…  i always have to twist my arm for paying..  Thats kinda uncool hahah
title: Cool…  one feature missing

author: Wayne Hadley
comment: Worked for a month on my g watch r then after verizon had an update it was down for 4 to 5 days then I got an update on samsung beam services and it works again. Not sure if that was the reason. Love using my watch to pay. People are still at aw....
title: Great app!

author: John Farley
comment: I used to have an Apple Watch and was accustomed to being able to pay for my purchases directly from the Starbucks app on my watch. Fast forward to now, and I find out that my new Android watch won't be able to get the Starbucks app on it, because Starbucks never developed an app for Android Wear. Luckily I discovered this third party solution, downloaded it on my new LG Watch Style, and tested it out at Starbucks. Worked without a hitch. It actually works more consistently than the official Starbucks app on the Apple Watch did. I'm sold. Thank you for developing this app. I look forward to seeing the Coffee Time watch face soon.

author: John Wilkinson
comment: On my sony smartwatch 3 the pop up with the card number covers the barcode rendering it pointless as it won't scan... But great other than that...
title: Shows promise but...

author: Eusebius Lai
comment: This was working great on my Huawei watch until I changed phones.  After re-pairing it to my new phone, I couldn't install this app.  For some reason it is listed as "not supported" for my watch, even though it was running fine on it when it was paired to my previous phone.  I can get the app just fine on my phone, it just won't show up on the watch.  Please add Huawei watch back to the list of supported devices!

author: Mike Reid
comment: Works well and is relatively easy to set up when you only have one watch. Unfortunately, trying to set it up with two watches is a bit of a nightmare. App doesn't reliably push the card number to both watches and even when you do get it set up (note: I have no trick for this, it's just keep trying until it automagically works)  flying-spaghetti-monster forbid you made a typo as that's even harder to fix.   Though at the end of the day, the look you get when you pay with your watch does indeed make it all worthwhile - and since Starbucks has forsaken Android Wear users with it's official app I'm grateful this one exists.

author: Luc Fournier
comment: Same as other users complained. The bottom card slide in, from the bottom, and cover the barcode,  make it useless. I emailed the developer with no luck.
title: Does not work on sony smartwatch 3

author: David B
comment: Zenwatch - The popup that displays the card number covers part of the Barcode like others have reported so not usable yet.
title: Can't use

author: Simon Hunter
comment: The card number slides in and covers some of the 2d barcode so it won't work. Emailed in report.
title: Doesn't work on Sony Smartwatch 3

author: David Maz
comment: Sometimes the coffee time command loads Google directions, but so far has scanned more reliably than my phone!
title: Works

author: Darrenlloyd Gent
comment: The number of the card that pops up obscures the actual barcode on the Gear Live, making it useless.

author: Rob Cordery
comment: Great, now that I have finally figured out the way to stop that yellow bit half covering the bar code is by setting the font size to small. Thanks for this app it's one of the apps that makes the smartwatch useful in a practical way as well as impressing the barista at my local Starbucks.

author: Kenny Truong
comment: The reactions from Starbucks' employees never get old.  Works well.
title: Awesome app!

author: Will N
comment: I have found the fix for it.  Change the font size which makes the Barcode to be readable.  Which makes the app on the watch usable and worth having.  I have yet to use but will change the review as accordingly after trying it out at a Starbucks.
title: Asus Zen Watch 2

author: Adam Stettler
comment: Simple interface, and has worked every time I've tried it.  Scans just fine right-side-up or upside-down.
title: Great app

author: Ted Hosmer
comment: Fun way to pay.  It also works upside down...very convenient if the scanner is on the same side as your watch arm.
title: Cool

author: Rey Velasquez
comment: It's a vital app for me as I'm an avid coffee drinker and Android Wear user.
title: A must have app for Android Wear Watches

author: Raul Arevalo
comment: Can open the app on phone but... Stopped showing up on LGWR.
title: No more app!

author: Ondrej Rosypal
comment: Does what it says. If it showed your balance I wouldn't have to use the (flawed) Starbucks app ever again, but I guess that's not realistic.

author: Johnny
comment: Can't use it with me. Samsung Gear S2...  What a bummer!!!

author: Michael Sofia
comment: No issues works fast even if the real Starbucks makes a wear version I'll still use this
title: Perfect

author: Ina Nenninger
comment: Please hurry and update.  I miss this on my new Android Wear 2.0 watch!

author: Tony Fyffe
comment: I like the day and date on mine.
title: Looking forward to watch faces

author: Eddie Gonzalez
comment: I've been using this great app since November 2014 (:
title: Awesome Goodness!

author: Nicholas Henry
comment: Super simple to get working and works every time. Using a Moto 360.
title: Does what it says

author: Devin Gonzales
comment: I use it a lot and love it
title: Awesome

author: Randy Rowles
comment: Wish it supported Dunkin in addition to Starbucks...

author: Robert Lewis
comment: Great for Moto 360

author: Dan Brown
comment: Very pleased with this app, I was initially a little skeptical that the size and resolution of the code on the watch would be sufficient to do the job, but it has scanned every time without fail.  Easy as pie to set up, too.  Running a Nexus 5, and a G-Watch.
title: Works Great!

author: PJ Orlando
comment: I just got the 360 using a GS5 and I tell you... The simple things in life is what I'm all about and this works like a cham! ;)
title: Works like a charm!

author: Eugene Hui
comment: I was sceptical that such a small barcode would scan properly at first, but it works, and I'm happy, I would give it 4 stars for getting me to have to tell people it's actually ANdroid Wear, but that's just illogical.
title: Expect to tell people it isn't an iWatch.

author: Ed Byerly
comment: Last card number wraps to second line and yellow box covers bottom of bar code. Otherwise, great app...
title: Sony SW 3 Set to large text..

author: Aron Anderson
comment: Simple, elegant, works every time.  You can also launch it in the App menu on your android wear device incase you don't want to look like james bond in the starbucks line
title: Fantastic

author: Isar Taheri
comment: Logs in only with a Starbucks card number and doesn't have any other way of loging in, for example email and password or nickname and password

reply.author: Not Just 4 Time
reply.content:
Hi Isar,

Thanks for at least trying out the the app.With all the security issues & database breaches going on in the world, we didn't want to be responsible for anyone's login credentials. We don't store any data on a server nor do we want to. That's why we don't ask for internet permissions or any permissions for that matter.

title: Doesnt register

author: Mista Erson
comment: ...Went the barista and some people on the queue when I used this app (London, UK) to pay for my coffee. App like this makes the use of Android Wear really worthy!
title: Woow..

author: Dave Stern
comment: Worked great in nyc, but there's no real check of the card #... So does that mean I can enter and keep trying card #s to see what works for free coffee?
title: Awesome... But....

author: Christopher Hunt
comment: Have used another version on the Sony Smartwatch 2 so was pleased to find it available for Android Wear even more delighted to discover the watch face. Good job!
title: Breaktime Essential

author: Andrew Khoo
comment: Malaysia. Moto 360 & Note 3. This works like a charm for Starbucks Malaysia card. Only wish that it would automatically boost up the brightness and loads up a lot more faster.
title: It works!

author: Steven Ercolani
comment: Doesn't ask for access to you Starbucks account. Just enter the card number and it will send the bar code to the watch.
title: Simple and works
